Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Arabic NF M 28
Descriptive title: Mimar and sermon of John Chrysostom
Related: Text continues from Arabic NF M 8; Arabic NF M 8, Arabic NF M 27, and Arabic NF M 28 originally belonged to the same manuscript
Author: John Chrysostom, Saint, -407
Contents note: 1. The Gospel of John; 2. Mimar of our holy father John Chrysostom of the ecumenical teacher, archbishop of the City of Byzantium of the Birth of our Lord Jesus Christ; 3. The other word of John Chrysostom, sermon to the monks; 4. From the canon of the apostles. Testament of the Apostle Paul.

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Syriac 2A
Related: Syriac 2A originally belonged together with ms. Chabot 12 (Milan, Biblioteca Ambrosiana)
Collation: Pastedown+flyleaf, Quire 1: 1x10 (10), Quire 2: 1x6 (16), Quire 3: 1x8 (24), Quire 4: 1+1x8 (33), Quires 5-12: 8x8 (97), Quire 13: 1x8+1 (106), Quire 14: 1x6+1+1 (114), Quire 15: 1x8 (122), Quire 16: 6x1 (128), Quire 17: 1x6+1 (135), Quire 18: 1x6+1 (142), Quire 19: 1x6 (148), Quire 20 (paper): 1x4 (152), Quire 21: 8x1 (160), Quire 22: 6x1 (166), Quire 23 (paper): 1x8, Quire 24 (paper): 1x6 (180), flyleaf+pastedown|~|Quire signatures at beginning and end of most quires. Quires 20, 23, and 24 are paper
Illustrations note: Minor geometric headpieces throughout, beginning on f. 31v
Binding note: Relatively recent; leather on wood showing signs of repair; metal studs (some missing) on front and back and along edges; remnants of clasps (four total, two for edge and one each at top and bottom)

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Syriac 7
Related: Syriac 7 originally belonged together with Sinai NF frag 55, Sinai NF frag 56, Sinai NF frag 57, London BL Or. 8609/II, Chabot 26-27 (Milan, Biblioteca Ambrosiana), Paris BNF syr. 382/I, Houghton syr. 171 (Cambridge, Harvard University), Hiersemann 500/10 (lost)
Foliation: Pencil numbered sequence of first folios: 1a, 1b, 2
Collation: Quire 1: 1x6+1 (6); Quires 2-6: 5x8 (46); Quire 7: 1x2 (48); Quire 8: 1x6 (54); Quires 9-10: 2x8 (70); Quire 11: 1x2 (72)|~|Quire signature at the beginning and end of most quires
Script note: Script and decoration reminiscent of Sinai Syriac 4 (Triodion)

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Syriac NF M 3
Foliation: Pencil foliation at either top or bottom
Collation: 1+1 (2); Quire 1: 8x1 (10); Quire 2: 8x1-1 (17); Quires 3-8: 8x8 (65); Quire 9: 1x6 (71); Quires 10-20: 11x8 (159); Quire 21: 1x2+1 (162); Quire 22: 1x2 (164)|~|Quire signatures in overtext
Binding note: Leather on wood; leather on front cover stitched; leather strap in front cover

Ink color: black; titles and punctuation in red, sometimes in yellow ink

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Syriac NF M 38
Descriptive title: John Climacus, The Ladder of Divine Ascent ; John Climacus, Letter to a Shepherd
Related: Originally part of the Codex Climaci rescriptus, belonging together with Cambridge, Westminster Theological College, now Washington, Museum of the Bible (Coll. Steve Green) and Mingana syr. 637 (Birmingham, Cadbury Research Library, Collection Mingana)
Author: John, Climacus, Saint, active 6th century
Contents note: Palimpsest ; Christian Palestinian Aramaic overwritten by John of Sinai's Ladder, chapter 31
Condition note: Four bifolios; first two bifolios with sewing present, but nonfunctional; second two bifolios with functional sewing

Condition note: Unbound quire; most of outer margin missing; large area at lower half missing throughout
